Detailed Description

A class that acts an abstract file resource.

It uses the proxy-pattern with a smart pointer to DataHandle being polymorphic depending on the file type used.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef ConstSmartPointer<DataResource> DataResource::ConstDataResourcePtr

ConstDataResourcePtr can be treated as a const pointer.

typedef SmartPointer<DataResource> DataResource::DataResourcePtr

DataResourcePtr can be treated as a normal pointer.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DataResource::DataResource ( void   ) 

The default constructor produces a DataResource on stand-by.

The resource on stand-by still needs to be loaded using the load() method.

DataResource::DataResource ( const std::string &  fileName  ) 

This constructor creates a DataResource based on the extension of the filename supplied.

Parameters:
fileName The full path and name of the file to be opened as a resource.

DataResource::DataResource ( const std::string &  fileName,
DataResourceType  type,
bool  createIfInvalid = false 
)

This constructor forces the file to be treated as an XML file, regardless of the filename extension.

It also allows the user to specify exact XML settings for the DOM API.

Parameters:
fileName The full path and name of the file to be opened as a resource.
type Indicates the type of the data resource.

Member Function Documentation

const std::string & DataResource::errorMessage ( void   ) 

This method is used to quietly obtain some user-meaningful text describing the error that has occurred.

Returns:
A string containing the error message.

DataHandle::Error DataResource::errorState ( void   ) 

This method is used to determine if the last operation resulted in success or a failure.

The actual return value signifies the error that occurred.

Returns:
The error code.

const std::string & DataResource::fileName ( void   ) 

This method returns the file-name.

Returns:
A const string containing the file name of the resource.

DataSectionPtr DataResource::getRootSection ( void   ) 

This method returns a pointer to a DataSection representing the top of the parse tree for the resource.

Returns:
A pointer to the root node of the resource. NULL if there was a problem.

DataHandle::Error DataResource::load ( const std::string &  fileName,
DataResourceType  type = RESOURCE_TYPE_XML 
)

This method will load the resource from the path specified.

If already opened, it does nothing.

Parameters:
fileName The full path and name of the file to be opened as a resource.
type The type of the data resource to load.
Returns:
DataHandle::DHE_NoError if there was no problem, otherwise it returns the DataHandle::Error code.

bool DataResource::loaded ( void   ) 

This method returns true if the DataResource has been loaded.

Returns:
True, if the DataResource has been loaded successfully. False, otherwise.

DataHandle::Error DataResource::reload ( void   ) 

This method will reload the resource from the path specified.

Returns:
DataHandle::DHE_NoError if there was no problem, otherwise it returns the DataHandle::Error code.

DataHandle::Error DataResource::save ( const std::string &  fileName = ""  ) 

This method will save the resource to the path specified.

Parameters:
fileName The path and name of the file to be saved to.
Returns:
DataHandle::DHE_NoError if there was no problem, otherwise it returns the DataHandle::Error code.
